column4: i had updated the grub in my system but still the problem exist whar shall i do to see my windows in my boot menu?
what shall i do to recover it?
i cant see my window s in my boot menue
how can i uninstall the old kernels?
what is the command for it?
you can run:  uname -a   to get the current kernel, then run:  dpkg -l | grep linux-image   to show the installed kernels
how can i find that the windows has no problem occured?
if i done that comand....is it harm to the linux operating system?
ya  i foun the current kernals installed   http://paste.ubuntu.com/1078116/
sudo dpkg -P linux-image-3.0.0-12-generic; sudo apt-get --purge remove linux-image-3.0.0-17-generic linux-image-3.0.0-24-generic
